data.description:
bonechiller is VERY slept on. it's often dismissed for its low handling and lack of quickdraw, but it boasts solid range and a ridiculous 61 aim assist, which is close to double the AA of all other energy slugs. in addition, you can stack firmly planted and opening shot for an even more ridiculous boost to accuracy. honestly, quick charge + quick access sling makes pretty much any shotgun's ready speed fast - you're not giving up too much there, either.
recommended mw: handling or range

data.description:
best non-sunset high impact as of end of season 15
in S16, high impacts are getting a damage bump, so

SEASON 15
this is going to sound like ass, but running liquid coils is not always terrible. liquid + high impact with no charge mw will almost always get the 3-bolt kill (~199 dmg) with no activation requirement, giving you a LOT more consistency. if you have a charge time mw or don't have high impact, go for the fastest charge time and pray you can get the 4-bolt.

SEASON 16
you can now 3 bolt 6 resilience or lower with accelerated + charge time mw + high impact, 8 res or lower with either (not both) accelerated or charge time
so that's just better

S15 recommended mw: charge time or range
S16 recommended mw: charge time
data.name: pvp

data.description:
contingency plan enjoyers, rejoice! aisha's is a fantastic rapid-fire scout that gives you pretty much anything you could want from the other non-sunset options without many of their weaknesses. it sits at a usable 21 zoom (think rifle scope ssf), which is lower than servant leader's 26 but slightly higher than contingency's 20 and trustee's 19. any of the damage perks will get you a 3c1b 4 tap (with adagio giving you the tasty kill clip 2c2b), including the interesting new focused fury perk, which you could totally proc while peek shotting with a scout rifle. you can also spec into ultimate consistency with eye of the storm. while I generally recommend perpetual motion (it's pretty much the ultimate perk), it admittedly doesn't make a lot of sense on a scout, but it might save you if you get caught off guard. also, bungo is finally starting to put unrelenting in the left column, where it belongs. goaded gun.
recommended mw: handling or range
data.name: pvp

data.description:

data.description:
the mad men. they actually did it. triple tap + fourth time's the charm. the math is bonkers on this one, with a 20-round magazine using appended mag shooting all the way up to ONE HUNDRED AND SEVEN SHOTS WITHOUT RELOADING. it's overflow without the activation requirement. now, i'm not saying that this is a bad roll, but you shouldn't rule out more traditional ammo perk + damage perk options. stats for all actually bumps your stats up by an insane amount, and the all for all roll (stats for all + one for all) has a fun loop with a huge payoff. focused fury is also perfect for a scout.
recommended mw: handling or reload
data.name: pve

the mad men. they actually did it. triple tap + fourth time's the charm. the math is bonkers on this one, with a 20-round magazine using appended mag shooting all the way up to ONE HUNDRED AND SEVEN SHOTS WITHOUT RELOADING. it's overflow without the activation requirement. now, i'm not saying that this is a bad roll, but you shouldn't rule out more traditional ammo perk + damage perk options. stats for all actually bumps your stats up by an insane amount, and the all for all roll (stats for all + one for all) has a fun loop with a huge payoff. focused fury is also perfect for a scout.
recommended mw: handling or reload

data.description:
best *obtainable* high impact as of end-of-season S15
kickstart CAN proc, you just need to start charging IMMEDIATELY after starting your slide. don't feed into misinformation.
in S16, high impacts are getting a damage bump, so

SEASON 15
this is going to sound like ass, but running liquid coils is not always terrible. liquid + high impact with no charge mw will almost always get the 3-bolt kill (~199 dmg) with no activation requirement, giving you a LOT more consistency. if you have a charge time mw or don't have high impact, go for the fastest charge time and pray you can get the 4-bolt.

SEASON 16
you can now 3 bolt 6 resilience or lower with accelerated + charge time mw + high impact, 8 res or lower with either (not both) accelerated or charge time
so that's just better

S15 recommended mw: charge time or range
S16 recommended mw: charge time

SEASON 15
this is going to sound like ass, but running liquid coils is not always terrible. liquid + high impact with no charge mw will almost always get the 3-bolt kill (~199 dmg) with no activation requirement, giving you a LOT more consistency. if you have a charge time mw or don't have high impact, go for the fastest charge time and pray you can get the 4-bolt.

SEASON 16
you can now 3 bolt 6 resilience or lower with accelerated + charge time mw + high impact, 8 res or lower with either (not both) accelerated or charge time
so that's just better

data.description:
sojourner's tale is pretty much as good as it gets for legendary energy slugs, with excellent stats all around, classic top tier perks, and some interesting rolls, too. can't go wrong with quickdraw + opening shot, though I would try threat detector - it's a toss up whether you'll be in range with a slug, but the constant bonus rather than quickdraw's on-draw effect will feel nice. tunnel vision is interesting because this is really the only special it will work on in pvp, since you have to reload one shot at a time (which also makes it easier to proc). killing wind seems intriguing for a legendary chaperone roll, but you can't exceed 100 range, so you would have to spec all into handling for it to have a noticeable effect (which isn't necessarily a bad thing).
recommended mw: range or handling
data.name: pvp

data.description:
lightweight sidearms are incredibly slept on. the most forgiving archetype with a 3c2b requirement, the 2nd fastest ttk at .67s, and the mobility bonus as a cherry on top. farewell is pretty much as good as lightweights get - you've got barrels for better stats, almost all desirable perks in the right column, and a choice between rangefinder for top-tier sidearm range or other consistency perks to make this thing aim for you. it should be noted that the difference between a max range roll and a base range roll is only about 3 meters, so while you can totally spec into range to make full use of the space around you, it's not strictly necessary. don't dismiss frenzy on a sidearm or smg for 6s - you're going to be moving around so much and getting into so many engagements that you can expect to have it up a reasonable amount of the time.
recommended mw: range or handling
data.name: pvp

data.description:
not sure why everyone just forgot about bottom dollar, but imo it's still top 5 for energy hand cannons and top 10 for hand cannons in general. oh right, it's because it comes from gambit (other than that pretty good one xur sold a while ago). this is a sniper hand cannon - before the 120 nerfs, it outranged pulses, and it can still hang today. unfortunately, high impact no longer gives free 2 taps, but you can still get 1c2b kills on low resilience guardians in the second half of the mag. of course, it has a miniscule mag, so that could be challenging to work around, but you can just treat it as a passive bonus - at that point, though, you may as well just have a damage perk. mkclip gets you the 2 tap on guardians 2 res or less, while rampage will always just get you a 1c2b.
recommended mw: range or handling

data.description:
purely in terms of burst, clown cartridge rockets are the highest dps option in the game (up to, like, 5 rockets). for total damage, explosive light has *slightly* higher dps than lasting impression, but that changes with wolfpack rounds. the perk appears to scale off of the rocket's blast damage, which is dramatically increased by lasting impression - something unavailable on ascendancy. it also has intrinsic tracking, putting it ahead of other lasting impression rockets. with one person on gjallarhorn, or with clown cartridge for burst, royal entry is the best rocket in the game.
recommended mw: reload
data.name: pve

data.description:
there was a time when everybody was saying this pulse is better than messenger. while thankfully that craze died down, third axiom is definitely still a good option, if constrained by its frame. adaptives have the slowest ttk of the pulse archetypes at .93s, but they're the most forgiving, requiring only 5c2b. as such, they have always shined in consistency - all adaptives feel *great* for some reason, and you don't need to be as accurate to achieve the optimal ttk (you can still 3 burst guardians 5 res or lower with only *one* headshot, and 2c7b will kill anyone). third axiom is no exception with its excellent stats and scope, and for some players (particularly on controller), it *might* be a better overall option than something like a messenger that requires more accuracy.
recommended mw: range
data.name: pvp

data.description:
there was a time when everybody was saying this pulse is better than messenger. while thankfully that craze died down, third axiom is definitely still a good option, if constrained by its frame. adaptives have the slowest ttk of the pulse archetypes at .93s, but they're the most forgiving, requiring only 5c2b. as such, they have always shined in consistency - all adaptives feel *great* for some reason, and you don't need to be as accurate to achieve the optimal ttk (you can still 3 burst guardians 5 res or lower with only *one* headshot, and 2c7b will kill anyone). third axiom is no exception with its excellent stats and scope, and for some players (particularly on controller), it *might* be a better overall option than something like a messenger that requires more accuracy. either mkclip x1 or rampage x1 will allow you to 3 burst with all body shots, while mkclip x2 will 5c0b anybody and rampage x2 will 5c1b all resiliences or 4c2b most. elemental capacitor gives you the potential to hit 100 in any of the affected stats pretty easily.
recommended mw: range
data.name: god-pvp

data.description:
there isn't a best sniper in any slot (other than whisper). what determines the value of a sniper is how it feels to each specific user: if you prefer the feel of aachen to beloved, you're going to perform better with aachen. with that said, looking at potential alone, frozen orbit is pretty likely to be your favorite. aggressive frames are a very popular pick because of the potential for easy clean ups and super shutdowns, and frozen orbit is the stat and perk monster of the agg frames. top tier options for all sniping playstyles: you can go for the classic handling + aim assist combo with something like firmly planted + snapshot, sit your ass down and lane with no distractions + opening shot, get reported for cheating with double aim assist perks like firmly planted + opening shot, or use your AWP to body shot people with kill clip or empowering rift + high impact. if snapshot were in the left column, frozen orbit would ruin crucible more than beloved or revoker ever did.
recommended mw: handling or range
data.name: pvp

woah, it's the best special weapon for dps and generally killing things fast! cartesian has the ability to compete with heavy weapons ON ITS OWN for damage, which makes it a viable braindead damage option when paired with anarchy (though it loses 100% to linears). lead from gold + double special breaks the ammo economy and is generally ridiculous for non-nightfall content and gambit. this thing will be a staple legendary in the game's history, up there with the greats like ikelos shotty and final round shotguns in destiny 1.
recommended mw: charge time

data.description:
nowhere near the best linear, but surprisingly not as terrible as you may think. box breathing is only cancelled when you fire before the 1s timer, not when you pull the trigger: as such, with some skillful timing, it can proc while you're charging for decent dps and really high total damage (box breathing is a *33% BUFF*). you'll want to run liquid coils and forego the charge time mw, as you'll be waiting 1s between each shot regardless. combine with field prep for extra reserves and even more total damage. tarantula may not kill things *fast,* but while other linears may fall just short, it will *definitely* kill things... eventually.
recommended mw: reload
data.name: pve

this is going to sound like ass, but running liquid coils is not always terrible. liquid + high impact with no charge mw will almost always get the 3-bolt kill (~199 dmg) with no activation requirement, giving you a LOT more consistency. if you have a charge time mw or don't have high impact, go for the fastest charge time and pray you can get the 4-bolt.

SEASON 16
you can now 3 bolt 6 resilience or lower with accelerated + charge time mw + high impact, 8 res or lower with either (not both) accelerated or charge time
so that's just better

data.description:
contingency plan enjoyers, rejoice! aisha's is a fantastic rapid-fire scout that gives you pretty much anything you could want from the other non-sunset options without many of their weaknesses. it sits at a usable 21 zoom (think rifle scope ssf), which is lower than servant leader's 26 but slightly higher than contingency's 20 and trustee's 19. any of the damage perks will get you a 3c1b 4 tap (with adagio giving you the tasty kill clip 2c2b), including the interesting new focused fury perk, which you could totally proc while peek shotting with a scout rifle. you can also spec into ultimate consistency with eye of the storm. while I generally recommend perpetual motion (it's pretty much the ultimate perk), it admittedly doesn't make a lot of sense on a scout, but it might save you if you get caught off guard. also, bungo is finally starting to put unrelenting in the left column, where it belongs. goaded gun.
recommended mw: handling or range
data.name: pvp

data.description:
the mad men. they actually did it. triple tap + fourth time's the charm. the math is bonkers on this one, with a 20-round magazine using appended mag shooting all the way up to ONE HUNDRED AND SEVEN SHOTS WITHOUT RELOADING. it's overflow without the activation requirement. now, i'm not saying that this is a bad roll, but you shouldn't rule out more traditional ammo perk + damage perk options. stats for all actually bumps your stats up by an insane amount, and the all for all roll (stats for all + one for all) has a fun loop with a huge payoff. focused fury is also perfect for a scout.
recommended mw: handling or reload
data.name: pve

data.description:
very slept on. everybody loves high impact pulses, and headseeker is a pretty popular pick for them bc it allows for a 4c2b when each burst begins with a body. however, high impact reserves - which rolls exclusively on premonition - also allows for a 4c2b in the second half of your mag with no other requirement.
